Luca_PI wrote:

>Hi Colin,
>
>there's a way in your implementation to start an experiment from a 
>saved genome?
>  
>

Hi,  This option isn't available at the moment - it's on my list of 
things to do. What I was intending to do is allow saving of the whole 
population or just the best genome, the user can then load entire 
populations back in and continue searching. SharpNEAT doesn't currently 
use the seed genome approach that original NEAT does. Instead I use a 
GenomeFactory class that generates random genomes with all of the inputs 
connected to all of the outputs. What I was intending to do was specify 
different GenomeFactory classes for each experiment, but actually I 
think providing a 'seed' genome might be a more user-friendly way of 
doing things.

 If I get chance I might do this over the weekend.

Regards,

Colin
